description: The story takes place in the near future in a city called Heartland. Tsukumo Yuma is a young duelist who strives to become the Duel Monsters champion, despite being an amateur. One day, during a duel with a school bully, a mysterious spirit called Astral appears before Yuma, and helps him to win. Astral then explains to Yuma that he is searching for his lost memories, which have been transformed into 99 "Xyz Monster" cards called "Numbers" and have been scattered across the globe. The "Numbers" have the ability to possess the duelists who own them and bring out their darkest desires. In order to recover his memories, and collect the "Numbers" cards, Astral teams up with Yuma.

tags.name: Card Battle

tags.name: Alternate Universe

tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

node.description:
The creator of Yu-Gi-Oh! He loved playing shogi, mahjong, card games, and tabletop role-playing games.

In an interview with Shonen Jump, Takahashi stated that his favorite manga from other authors included Akira by Katsuhiro Otomo, JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by Hirohiko Araki, and Dragon Ball by Akira Toriyama. He also enjoyed reading American comics, with Hellboy being his favorite American comic book character.

On July 6, 2022, a body in snorkeling gear was found off the coast of Nago City, Okinawa, which was identified the following day as Takahashi. It was revealed by a U.S. Army Officer that Takahashi attempted to aid in the rescue of three people at a riptide in Mermaid's Grotto, Onna, on July 4, 2022.

moumoon is a Japanese pop duo consisting of two members: vocalist and lyricist Yuka and composer Kousuke Masaki. Formed in 2005, the duo signed with Gate Records in 2006, and released their debut single "Flowers/Pride", and mini-album Flowers that September. In 2007, they left Gate Records and signed with Avex Trax, releasing their second mini-album, Love Me? in August. The duo's name is a combination of the French "Mou" and the English "Moon", together meaning "Soft Moon"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1314120680091209728)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/154741/)._

Hiroko & Miyake on vocals.  mihimaru GT is a two-person group signed with the major record label Universal Music Japan. Made up of composer, lyricist, and vocalist Miyake and vocalist/lyricist Hiroko, the duet have tried their hand at fusing an urban sound with more traditional J-pop elements.  (Source: jame-world)
